licence associée à ce produit interdit toute utilisation de tout fichier ou extrait sélectionné dans ce produit. L’utilisation par des tiers, y compris,
sans toutefois s’y limiter, des éditeurs, des professeurs particuliers, des services de tutorat ou d’aide aux études, des établissements de
préparation à l’enseignement supérieur, des fournisseurs de services de planification des programmes d’études, des gestionnaires de
plateformes pédagogiques en ligne, et des développeurs d’applications, moyennant paiement ou non, est interdite et constitue une infraction
pénale.

© Organización del Bachillerato Internacional, 2023

Todos los derechos reservados. No se podrá reproducir ninguna parte de este producto de ninguna forma ni por ningún medio electrónico o
mecánico, incluidos los sistemas de almacenamiento y recuperación de información, sin la previa autorización por escrito del IB. Además, la
licencia vinculada a este producto prohíbe el uso de todo archivo o fragmento seleccionado de este producto. El uso por parte de terceros —lo
que incluye, a título enunciativo, editoriales, profesores particulares, servicios de apoyo académico o ayuda para el estudio, colegios
preparatorios, desarrolladores de aplicaciones y entidades que presten servicios de planificación curricular u ofrezcan recursos para docentes
mediante plataformas digitales—, ya sea incluido en tasas o no, está prohibido y constituye un delito.

En este enlace encontrará más información sobre cómo solicitar una autorización por escrito en forma de licencia: https://ibo.org/become-an-ib-

                                                                      –3–                                                                    8823 – 6018M

Subject Details: Biology SL Paper 3 Markscheme

Candidates are required to answer all questions in Section A and all of the questions from one option in Section B. Maximum total = 35
marks.

1.    Each row in the “Question” column relates to the smallest subpart of the question.

2.    The maximum mark for each question subpart is indicated in the “Total” column.

3.    Each marking point in the “Answers” column is shown by means of a semicolon (;) at the end of the marking point.

4.    A question subpart may have more marking points than the total allows. This will be indicated by “max” written after the mark in the
      “Total” column.
      The related rubric, if necessary, will be outlined in the “Notes” column.

5.    An alternative word is indicated in the “Answers” column by a slash (/). Either word can be accepted.

6.    An alternative answer is indicated in the “Answers” column by “OR”. Either answer can be accepted.

7.    An alternative markscheme is indicated in the “Answers” column under heading ALTERNATIVE 1 etc. Either alternative can be accepted.

8.    Words inside brackets ( ) in the “Answers” column are not necessary to gain the mark.

9.    Words that are underlined are essential for the mark.

10.   The order of marking points does not have to be as in the “Answers” column, unless stated otherwise in the “Notes” column.
                                                                 –4–                                8823 – 6018M



                                                             Section A


Question                                           Answers                                 Notes    Total
1. a       a. I: cell(surface) membrane/plasma membrane;                        a. do not accept
           b. II: cell wall;                                                    membrane alone       2
1. b i     salt solution
           OR                                                                                        1
           hypertonic solution;
1. b ii    a. cells are plasmolyzed/flaccid
               OR
               plasma membrane has separated from the cell wall
               OR
                                                                                                     2
               cytoplasm/cell/vacuole has shrunk/decreased in size/lost mass;
           b. cells have lost water (by osmosis);


1. c       160;                                                                 no units required    1

Question                                       Answers                                                      Notes              Mark
2. a       Similarities:
           a. as pH increases, enzyme activity increases (up to optimum pH) and then               Mp a. reference to
              decreases;                                                                           increase and decrease
                                                                                                   required
           b. both enzymes show lowest activity at low pH/pH3 and high pH/pH11
              OR
              at extremes of pH enzyme activity is low;

           Differences
           c. optimum pH of immobilized lipase is (close to) 8 and the optimum pH of free                                       3
               lipase is (close to) 7                                                                                          max
               OR
               optimum pH of immobilized lipase is more alkaline/higher than optimum pH of
               free lipase;
           d. immobilized enzymes are less affected by pH than free enzymes                        Mp d. OWTTE the
               OR                                                                                  candidates may only refer
               immobilized enzymes have more activity at most pH values (except for pH 7);         to after or before pH 7
                                                                                                   which should be awarded
                                                                                                   the mark
2.   b     temperature / enzyme concentration / substrate concentration / time / total volume of
           reaction / type of substrate;

                                                                                             marks.

                                                                                             enough for either mark.

               information;

Option B – Biotechnology and bioinformatics
Question                                     Answers                                                          Notes            Total
9. a i   2005;                                                                                                                   1
9. a ii a. less production/lower yields, as weeds compete with crop plants (for
                 nutrients/light/space);
             b. (higher costs/less profit, as) other/more herbicides are needed to kill resistant
                                                                                                                                1
                                                                                                                               max
                 weeds;
             c. (higher costs/less profit, as) tillage needed to get rid of weeds;
9.   a   iii use/introduce marker/reporter/antibiotic resistance gene
             OR
             fluorescence                                                                                                       1
             OR
             plant cells don’t die if sprayed with glyphosate;
9.   b   i recombinant (DNA);                                                                       Do not accept
                                                                                                    transgenic DNA.             1

9.   b   ii   a. an electric field is applied to cells;                                             Do not accept

                 OR                                                                                 force.                      2
                 genes/recombinant DNA introduced through pores;

10. a i      a. the effectiveness is measured by the size of the inhibition zone / clear area (of
                  the agar);
             b. B/A and B are the most effective/have a similar effect
                  OR                                                                                                          2
                  C is less effective than A and B                                                                           max
                  OR
                  D has little/no effect on bacteria
             c. the evidence for the effectiveness comes from no inhibition in X;
10. a   ii   to allow time for the growth of the bacterial population
             OR
             to allow time for antibacterial agents to have effect on bacterial populations/to
                                                                                                                              1
             diffuse;
10. b

              staining

                                                                  – 13 –                                                            8823 – 6018M

Question                                           Answers                                                        Notes            Total
11. a       a. (hypothesis supported as)
               smooth surface (stainless steel) has no biofilm whereas rougher surface (shrimp/crab)
               has more biofilm
               OR
               slightly rough surface (shrimp) has less biofilm than the very rough surface (crab)
               OR
               the rougher the surface the greater the biofilm;

            b. (hypothesis not supported as)                                                                                         2
               more surfaces should be tested before valid conclusion can be made
               OR
               same species/material with different degrees of roughness should be tested for valid
               conclusions
               OR
               since different species/material were used the differences may be due to other factors;

11. b   i   a. formation of EPS (extracellular polymeric substance/exopolysaccharide);                   Accept other valid
            b. cooperation/quorum sensing;                                                               property.
                                                                                                                                     1
            c. antibiotic resistance;                                                                                               max

              h. brief account of method of another example;

12.        a.   (deep-tank) batch fermentation;
           b.   penicillin is a secondary metabolite;
           c.   oxygen is supplied to the fermentation tank as the fungus needs aerobic conditions;
           d.   corn syrup added as a nutrient causes faster growth;
                                                                                                                                    4
                                                                                                                                   max
           e.   optimum temperature/pH must be maintained for enzymes/Penicillium growth;             Mp e: enzyme activity or
           f.   penicillin is extracted/purified/filtered/crystalized;                                Penicillium growth must be
                                                                                                      mentioned for the mark

13. a i      absorption/uptake (by plants)                                             Do not accept weathering
             OR                                                                        or soil erosion.
             leaching;                                                                 Do not accept runoff as
                                                                                       this from the surface and
                                                                                                                     1
                                                                                       the litter, not the soil.

13. a   ii




                                                                                                                     1




                                                                   X/weathering;

13. b        a. (due to high rate of) decay/decomposition / activity of decomposers;
             b. encouraged by high temperatures/high humidity (in forest floor);       Mp b. must make               2
                                                                                       reference to high/elevated   max
                                                                                       temperature or humidity
                                                                 – 17 –                                          8823 – 6018M




Question                                          Answers                                                Notes   Total
14. a      a. ingesting microplastics (significantly) reduces the ability to jump high so less
              successful / more easily trapped by predators;
           b. no significant difference in frequency of jumps so no change in success / the ability to
              escape from predators                                                                               2
              OR                                                                                                 max
              microplastic group jumps more often so more successful in escaping from predators;
           c. it is not clear from the data whether the height or frequency of jumps is more important
              in allowing beachhoppers to escape from predators;
14. b      a. animals/marine mammals/turtles get entangled in plastics so they may drown/have
              their ability to catch food impaired/suffer wounds /movement impaired;
           b. (macroplastics break down and) can concentrate/may release chemicals that can
              enter marine food chains/bioaccumulate/biomagnify;
           c. ingested plastics may block the gut/damage stomach linings, so animals cannot feed;                 2
                                                                                                                 max
           d. ingested plastics may prevent marine animals from breathing / cause suffocation /
              choking;
           e. large plastic patches block light for photosynthesis;
                                                                 – 18 –                                                          8823 – 6018M




Question                                  Answers                                                    Notes                       Total
15. a      A as it has the greatest core area / smallest edge / less edge effect
           OR
           A as it has more stable conditions/less interaction with other                                                         1
           environments/less exposure to other species/predators/less edge to
           escape from;
15. b      a. corridors allow organisms to move between fragmented/isolated
              habitats;
           b. organisms can find better living conditions such as food
              resources/shelter/nesting;
           c. more successful reproduction / allows genetic variation /            Mp c. Do not accept increasing biodiversity    3
              maintains/increases gene pool;                                                                                     max
           d. corridors allow species to migrate in response to climate change;
           e. example of corridors;                                                Mp e. Examples of corridors include
                                                                                   tunnels under busy roads/green
                                                                                   corridors/elephant corridors in India

              maintains genetic diversity;

              OR
              plant seeds stored in seed banks;

           stethoscope;                                                                                                     1


21. b      a. it picks up the (electrical) impulses from the sinoatrial node/SAN;               Do not accept ‘messages’

              OR
              it makes the ventricles contract;                                                                             2
                                                                                                                           max
           c. it delays the transmission of the electrical impulses
              OR
              allows atria to contract before ventricles;
                                                                 – 24 –                                                                8823 – 6018M




Question                                           Answers                                                          Notes              Total
22.        a. malnutrition caused by deficiency or excess of nutrients                                   In the first alternative of
              OR                                                                                         mp a. both the idea of
              malnutrition is caused by an imbalance of nutrients;                                       deficiency and excess
                                                                                                         needed.
           Deficiency of: (Max 2 marks)
           b. amino acids, leading to body not synthesizing proteins required/hemoglobin/plasma          The candidates should
              proteins/poor growth/intellectual disability;                                              give the name of the
           c. calcium, leading to rickets/poor bone mineralization/osteomalacia                          substance and not only
              OR                                                                                         list the consequences
              any other mineral deficiency + consequence;
           d. vitamin D, leading to poor absorption of calcium/osteomalacia/poor bone
                                                                                                                                        4
                                                                                                                                       max
              mineralization
              OR
              any other vitamin deficiency + consequence;
           e. overall food deficiency/anorexia leads to wasting of muscles/body tissues;

           Excess of: (Max 2 marks)
           f. fats/cholesterol/salts leading to cardiovascular diseases/hypertension/ atherosclerosis;
                                                                                                         Accept any other food
           g. carbohydrates/sugars, leading to diabetes type 2;                                          taken in excess and the
           h. food/named nutrient leading to obesity;                                                    health consequence.
